intro: Zigadenus nuttallii, commonly known as death cup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces a toxic sap that contains various alkaloids, making it dangerous to handle. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its toxicity, it is important to avoid contact with any part of the plant.
